item.title: 中美重启贸易谈判，重点关注稀土出口
item.description: 中美两国的最高贸易谈判代表将于周一在伦敦举行新一轮会谈，这为世界上最大的两个经济体化解因中国在稀土矿产领域的主导地位而产生的紧张局势带来了一线希望。【原文：Top trade negotiators from the US and China are set to hold fresh talks in London on Monday, offering a glimmer of hope that the world’s two largest economies can defuse tensions over Chinese dominance in rare-earth minerals.】

item.title: 最不受青睐的债券 "让美国例行拍卖成为关键考验
item.description: 全球投资者对长期国债的反弹正将通常只是例行公事的美国债券拍卖变成本周华尔街最受瞩目的事件之一。【原文：Global investor pushback against long-term government debt is turning what normally would be a routine US bond auction into one of the most anticipated events on Wall Street this week.】

item.title: Lone Star 旗下的 Novo Banco 据称将获得 BPCE 和 CaixaBank 的竞标
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，Lone Star 旗下的葡萄牙贷款机构 Novo Banco SA 吸引了法国银行集团 BPCE 和西班牙 CaixaBank SA 的两份竞标。【原文：Lone Star’s Portuguese lender Novo Banco SA attracted two bids from French banking group BPCE and CaixaBank SA of Spain, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 委内瑞拉计划将燃油费提高 50%，以应对收入下滑
item.description: 美国石油巨头雪佛龙（Chevron）公司和其他石油公司停止了在委内瑞拉的工作，委内瑞拉政府正在为燃油价格上涨 50%做准备。【原文：Venezuela’s government is laying the groundwork for a 50% hike in fuel prices at the pump as it braces for a decrease in revenues after US oil major Chevron and other oil firms halted work in the country.】

item.title: 哈塞特称美国寻求在伦敦就中国稀土流动问题达成协议
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的一位高级经济助理表示，美国谈判代表周一在伦敦与中国同行进行新一轮贸易谈判时，将致力于恢复关键矿产品的流通。【原文：US negotiators will aim to restore the flow of critical minerals when they meet their Chinese counterparts for a new round of trade negotiations Monday in London, a top economic aide to President Donald Trump said.】

item.title: 收益率猎人推动 3,310 亿美元的新兴债券销售浪潮
item.description: 渴求收益率的投资者需求强劲，推动发展中国家债券销售激增，因为借款人竞相在全球市场进一步动荡之前获得融资。【原文：Strong demand from yield-hungry investors is driving a surge in developing-world bond sales as borrowers race to secure financing ahead of any further wobbles in global markets.】

item.title: 苹果 iOS 26 液晶玻璃界面专为 20 周年纪念版 iPhone 打造
item.description: 全新的软件设计风格将成为苹果全球开发者大会的核心，并为即将到来的 iPhone 大改版奠定基础。此外：公司选定了一年一度的返校促销日期，并准备在零售店扩大 iPhone 运营商促销活动。【原文：A new software design style will be at the center of Apple’s Worldwide Developers Conference — and set the stage for an upcoming iPhone overhaul. Also: The company picks the date for its annual back-to-school deal and prepares to expand iPhone carrier promotions in its retail stores.】

item.title: 与以色列有联系的巴勒斯坦民兵在战火纷飞的加沙出现
item.description: 一支在以色列默许下开展行动的巴勒斯坦民兵组织已在加沙地带浮出水面，有望在战后取代哈马斯的管理。【原文：A Palestinian militia operating with tacit approval from Israel has surfaced in the Gaza Strip, offering a prospective postwar alternative to Hamas governance.】

item.title: 谈判势头强劲，美国贸易团队据称将延长印度驻留时间
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，目前正在印度进行谈判的美国贸易团队已经延长了停留时间，这表明谈判正在7月最后期限之前取得进展。【原文：A US trade team that’s currently in India for negotiations has extended its stay, according to people familiar with the matter, in a sign talks are progressing ahead of a July deadline.】

item.title: 纳格尔告诉 DLF，欧洲央行在利率问题上有最大的灵活性
item.description: 欧洲中央银行管理委员会委员约阿希姆-纳格尔（Joachim Nagel）在接受《德国之声》采访时表示，他无法判断今年的降息是否已经结束，下一步完全没有定论。【原文：European Central Bank Governing Council member Joachim Nagel said he can’t judge if interest-rate cuts are over for this year and next steps are totally open, according to an interview with Deutschlandfunk.】

item.title: 埃斯克里瓦称欧洲央行的中央利率方案可能需要微调
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员何塞-路易斯-埃斯克里瓦（Jose Luis Escriva）表示，目前指导欧洲中央银行货币政策的假设可能需要调整。【原文：The assumptions currently guiding European Central Bank monetary policy may need tweaking, according to Governing Council member Jose Luis Escriva.】

item.title: Meta 正在洽谈规模高达 100 亿美元的人工智能投资项目
item.description: 据知情人士透露，Meta Platforms 公司正在洽谈向人工智能初创公司 Scale AI 投资数十亿美元。【原文：Meta Platforms Inc. is in talks to make a multibillion-dollar investment into artificial intelligence startup Scale AI, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 前贸易顾问称英国与美国达成协议的时间表过于雄心勃勃
item.description: 英国前最高贸易谈判代表基尔-斯塔默（Keir Starmer）表示，首相需要唐纳德-特朗普总统 "格外慷慨"，才能实现他在两周内敲定英美关税协议的雄心壮志。【原文：Prime Minister Keir Starmer would need President Donald Trump to be “extraordinarily generous” to meet his ambition of finalizing the UK-US tariff deal in two weeks, according to Britain’s former top trade negotiator.】

item.title: 工党最担心的是没有人会感受到创纪录的支出激增
item.description: 英国工党政府将于本周向该国饱受重创的公共服务部门进行历史性投资；为医疗保健、教育和交通等领域增资 3,000 亿英镑（4,060 亿美元），这是至少自 2010 年以来最大的一次持续增资。【原文：Britain’s Labour government will make an historic investment into the country’s battered public services this week — a £300 billion ($406 billion) uplift for areas such as health care, education and transport, amounting to the largest sustained funding increase since at least 2010.】

item.title: 全球基金押注韩股在改革顺风中大爆发
item.description: 多年来，投资者一直对韩国股市表现不佳感到沮丧，如今他们越来越乐观地认为，新总统推行的股东友好政策最终将带来更丰厚的回报。【原文：After years of frustration with South Korea’s underperforming stock market, investors are growing more optimistic that the new president’s push for shareholder-friendly policies will finally deliver stronger returns.】

item.title: 里夫斯将在支出审查中宣布为科技拨款 860 亿英镑
item.description: 下周的支出审查将公布一项860亿英镑的科技一揽子计划，作为其中的一部分，药物治疗和长效电池研究将获得新的资金支持。【原文：Research into drug treatments and longer-lasting batteries will receive new funding as part of an £86 billion package for science and technology set to be announced in next week's spending review.】

item.title: 马克龙称应继续为节能住宅提供补贴
item.description: 在财政部表示将暂时停止住房翻新补贴计划后，法国总统埃马纽埃尔-马克龙（Emmanuel Macron）呼吁政府继续实施该计划。【原文：French President Emmanuel Macron called on his government to continue a home renovation subsidy program after the finance ministry said it would temporarily halt the grants.】

item.title: 关税惠及消费者，美国通胀率将走高
item.description: 5 月份，美国消费者可能会看到通胀略有加快，尤其是商品通胀，因为公司会逐渐转嫁较高的进口关税。【原文：US consumers probably saw slightly faster inflation in May, notably for merchandise, as companies gradually pass along higher import duties.】

item.title: 欧洲央行施纳贝尔称现在是提升欧元作用的正确时机
item.description: 欧洲中央银行执行董事会成员伊莎贝尔-施纳贝尔（Isabel Schnabel）认为，随着投资者转向欧洲，现在是加强欧元全球作用的有利时机。【原文：European Central Bank Executive Board member Isabel Schnabel sees a favorable moment now to strengthen euro’s global role as investors turn to Europe.】

item.title: 企业现金水平开始下降
item.description: 最近一个财报期可能是美国高等级公司信贷质量的一个预警信号。【原文：The latest earnings period brought what might be an early warning sign about credit quality for high-grade US companies.】

item.title: 拉加德告诉摩纳哥信息报：欧洲央行在利率问题上处于有利地位
item.description: 欧洲央行行长克里斯蒂娜-拉加德（Christine Lagarde）对摩纳哥信息电视台说，最新的利率举措为欧洲央行实现中期通胀目标做好了准备。【原文：The latest interest-rate moves primes the European Central Bank to meet its medium-term inflation goal, President Christine Lagarde told television station Monaco Info.】

item.title: Swen Capital 海洋基金首期募集资金 1.6 亿欧元
item.description: Swen Capital Partners 在其专注于海洋生物多样性再生的影响力风险投资基金首次关闭时筹集了 1.6 亿欧元（1.82 亿美元）。【原文：Swen Capital Partners has raised €160 million ($182 million) at the first close of its impact venture fund focused on the regeneration of ocean biodiversity.】

item.title: 中国在美国谈判前批准部分稀土出口
item.description: 中国政府称已批准部分稀土出口申请，此举可能会缓解中美两国下周贸易谈判前的紧张局势。【原文：Beijing says it granted approval to some applications for the export of rare earths, a move that could ease tensions before trade negotiations between the US and China next week.】

item.title: 改变与中国和那些讨厌的律师的游戏规则
item.description: 欢迎收看《华尔街一周》时事通讯，我们将为您带来资本主义的故事，您需要知道的事情，但您更需要思考的事情。我是大卫-威斯汀（David Westin），本周我们与哈佛大学的拉里-萨默斯（Larry Summers）和胡佛研究所的尼尔-弗格森（Niall Ferguson）就中国的未来进行了圆桌讨论，并探讨了律师事务所投资的发展世界。如果您还不是订阅者，请在此注册订阅本新闻通讯。【原文：Welcome to the Wall Street Week newsletter, bringing you stories of capitalism about things you need to know, but even more things you need to think about. I'm David Westin, and this week we held a roundtable discussion with Larry Summers of Harvard and Niall Ferguson of the Hoover Institution about the future of China and explored the developing world of investing in law firms. If you're not yet a subscriber, sign up here for this newsletter.】

item.title: 交易员寻找 "难以捉摸 "的催化剂，推动 S&P 500 指数再创新高
item.description: 对于股票交易者来说，目前没什么好担心的。美国公司不断创造稳健的收益。经济衰退的可能性并不大。唐纳德-特朗普总统的关税政策有望在不久之后变得更加明朗。【原文：For stock traders there’s little to fear at the moment. Corporate America keeps churning out solid earnings. The chances of a recession aren’t blaring. And President Donald Trump’s tariff policy is expected to become more clear before long.】

item.title: 施纳贝尔：不要指望美联储与欧洲央行持续脱钩
item.description: 执行董事会成员伊莎贝尔-施纳贝尔（Isabel Schnabel）认为，期望美国联邦储备委员会和欧洲中央银行之间持续存在政策分歧是错误的。【原文：It would be wrong to expect a persistent policy divergence between the US Federal Reserve and the European Central Bank, according to Executive Board member Isabel Schnabel.】

item.title: 英国央行行长格林认为通货紧缩仍将持续，尽管短期内会出现峰值
item.description: 英国央行利率制定者梅根-格林（Megan Greene）表示，尽管近期消费价格增长加快，但英国的通货紧缩仍将持续。【原文：Bank of England rate-setter Megan Greene said disinflation in the UK is set to continue despite an acceleration in consumer-price growth in the near term.】

item.title: 中国的困境如何复活了 "革命 "这一经济术语
item.description: 长期的经济挑战往往会产生自己的术语。2008 年危机后的几年里，当美国在低增长和低于目标的通胀率中挣扎时，"世俗停滞 "成了常用语。日本的情况更糟，因此产生了 "通货紧缩心态"。【原文：Prolonged economic challenges tend to generate their own terminology. When the US struggled with low growth and below-target inflation in the years after the 2008 crisis, the oft-used phrase was “secular stagnation.” Even worse conditions in Japan gave rise to a “deflationary mindset.”】

item.title: 欧洲央行武契奇称降息已接近尾声
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员鲍里斯-武伊契奇（Boris Vujcic）表示，欧洲中央银行的降息行动已接近尾声。【原文：The European Central Bank’s interest-rate cutting campaign is almost over, Governing Council member Boris Vujcic said.】

item.title: 销售额未达目标，中国领导人掌管美国 TikTok 商店
item.description: TikTok 的母公司 ByteDance Ltd. 一直在西雅图附近用与中国有联系的领导人替换在美国雇佣的员工，旨在复制其在美国销售不佳后在亚洲取得的电子商务成功。【原文：ByteDance Ltd., TikTok’s parent company, has been replacing US-hired staff near Seattle with leaders connected to China, aiming to replicate its e-commerce success in Asia after sales fell short in America.】
